text: Refrigerated 11.2 oz. aluminum can poured into a glass. Opaque dark violet, medium/thick body, medium/lower carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is rich comple tart blueberry. Really nice lambic

Pours as dark rubyish purple as you can imagine with a dense pink head. Really very pretty stuff. Intense blueberry and sour cherry smell. Slight yoghurt sour with citrussy fruity aromas. Very rich and fruity taste and wildly sour too. Lingering dry berryskin aftertaste. Wild!

Tap at Beer Hunters, Pori. Deep deep red colour, pinky head. Aroma has blueberries, blueberries, tartness, lactic notes. Medium to full-bodied. Intensive fresh blueberry flavour, nice tartness but with good drinkability. Blueberry bomb. Amazing.

Can, best before 6.28.17, drunk 3/28/17.Pretty awesome neon-violet-ruby-pink body seems lightly hazy with a violet-pink-tinged off-white head that shows moderate retention for the style (rating it as sour/wild). Lots of blueberry sediment left on the bottom.Very bright, poignant blueberry notes mix with a good deal of oak while moderate Brett adds a more gentle fruitiness and tartness to the mix. Lots of blueberry skin/tannin adding a more deep pepper-like spiciness and light vegetal character that does help balance the more intense acidity. Malt is very light with dry wheat-like character showing through lightly but little/no sweetness. No alcohol or flaw.In the mouth its intensely acidic though softened by the wheat/malt and blueberry skin tannin. They definitely did not skimp on the blueberry and it shows coming through in every possible way here. To that end, its a bit dominated by the blueberry, though I still find it very enjoyable as blueberry is a very mild but flavorful fruit. Vanilla, oak, soft woody character and lots of spice on the finish with low but engaging carbonation and no alcohol or flaw. A weird one, and somewhat lacking on the beer aspect, but I respect the obvious care that went in to it and I love how raw and real the blueberry is.

Accidental can purchase from K&L in Redwood City, CA (didnt realize this cost $13 until I had already paid). Pour is vibrant purple with a thick foam of dusty magenta. Aroma is funk, fossilized blueberries, cloven hooves, petrified beasts. Taste is tart, sour funk, spicy funk, vinegar, wine, tannic, grape peels, very mild undercurrent of blueberries. Perhaps it was the bright can or the other reviews seeming to downplay the funk, but this is way more funk than expected. Maybe even the funkiest funked out beer Ive had which isnt bad, just was expecting more fruit depth. Still an incredibly funky beer...probably not worth the entry fee though.
Awesome looking. Insane blueberry fruitness. Decent sourness. Quite dry, red wine-ish, tart. Some vinegar, especially in the aroma but acceptable. Alcohol is hidden as hell. Simple but I liked it!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Cudownie owocowe, z genialnie ukrytym alkoholem.

2017/04/17 - Pours a dark purple colour with a foamy, purple head that quickly dissipated and leaves moderate, patchy lacing. Aroma is tartiness, berries , lemon, grapes, red wine, wood, leather and musty funk. Taste is tart berries and lemon, musty-barnyard funk, dry tannic grapes and grape skins, wine and wood with hints of leather and hay. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with soft carbonation and a tart, dry, tannic finish. Not as much berry notes as I had expected, but still very well put together. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mikkeller SpontanTripleBlueberry
Mikkeller
Brewed at De Proefbrouwerij
Copenhagen, Denmark 
10% Lambic Style - Fruit
BGM 5
Tap @ Beer Geek Madness 5. (Backlog). Very dark, low head. Wild, barnyard, hay, leather, dark fruits, blackberries, strawberries, wine. Very dry, sour, no alcohol perceptible, soft carbonation.
BGM Backlog. Blueberry, leather, tannin, barnyard, earthy. Medium sour, tart.
Backlog. V edycja Beer Geek Madness w Zaklętych Rewirach we Wrocławiu, 1.04.2017

(Keg at HBF2017) The beer poured nearly black. Its head was medium sized and purple. Aroma had tartness, fruitiness and blueberries. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were tartness, fruitiness, sweetness, blueberries and low bitterness. Aftertaste was tart, sweet and bitter. A nice tart brew with mostly subtle blueberry notes.
Fresh from the tap at Berr Geek Madness Nr. 5 in Wroclaw. Deep blue-black with extreme fruity notes.
Great drinkability. Where is that 10 percent of alcohol? There is very strong aroma of blueberry. Great sourness, a lot of funky aromas, really good beer!
[BGM5] Dzikie i mocno kwaśne. Intensywnie owocowe, po ogrzaniu wychodzą dzikie i lekko wytrawne nuty. Dobre.

Zapach intensywny, owoce leśne, jagody, borówki, ziemia, stajnia. Kolor ciemnofioletowy, nieprzejrzyste. Piana różowa, średnio obfita, drobna, trwała, piękny lacing. W smaku wytrawne, średnia kwaśność, średnia pełnia, borówki, jagody, ziemia, stajnia. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.
Pite na BGM. Podane za zimne. Super funky i owoce, niesamowicie pijalne, fajny kolor. Kwaśne, mimo to nie odrzuca.
Draught. Funk, leather, berries in aroma. In taste fruity and sour, very dry, medium to high sourness in finish. Expected more berries to kick in but still really tasty.
BGM5 1.04.2017, Zaklęte Rewiry Wrocław, ocena przepisana z notatek , próbka 100ml

tap/bgm5. piękne i intensywnie fioletowe, drobnopęcherzykowa, biała piana ładnie oblepiająca szkło. aromat owocowy, jagodowy, wyraźne nuty funky. w smaku pełne, gładkie, kwaśne, z przyjemnymi, dzikimi nutami na podniebieniu. alkohol niewyczuwalny, nasycenie zerowe, kawał piwa
UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Sample at Beer Geek Madness 5: very fruity, thick, almost oily beer. Moderately sour, very drinkable, with perfectly hidden alcohol. Great beer!

Próbka pita na BGM.
Piana wysoka, opada do trwałej, cienkiej warstwy. Aromat super jagodowy, lekko dziki. Intensywny i przyjemny. W smaku mocno kwaśne, jagoda tutaj nieco chowa się w tło, względem aromatu. Brettowy finisz. Alkohol ukryty fe-no-me-nal-nie. Mikkeller rozjebał po raz kolejny.

Draught at BGM5
Aroma-berries 
Appearance-red, hazy, rouge foam
Taste-medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very good

330 ml can into tulip glass, best before 6/28/2017. Pours nearly opaque dark ruby/purple color with a 1-2 finger dense dark purple head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of huge tart/sour blueberry, blackberry, currant, raisin, plum, red grape, fruit skin, lemon, lime, green apple, oak, wheat, and bread; with lighter notes of hay, leather, pepper, musty funk, red wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, blueberries, oak barrel, and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tart/sour blueberry, blackberry, currant, raisin, plum, red grape, fruit skin, lemon, lime, green apple, oak, wheat, and bread; with lighter notes of hay, leather, pepper, musty funk, red wine vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Light-moderate fruity/tangy/lactic tartness and light fruit skin/tannic oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/sour blueberry, blackberry, currant, raisin, plum, red grape, fruit skin, lemon, lime, green apple, oak, wheat, bread, light hay/funk/vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, blueberries, oak barrel, and moderate bready malt flavors; with an amazing malt/tartness balance; and zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light dryness from tartness/tangy fruit; lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy/acidic, and lightly tannic balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol for 10%. Overall this is an amazing imperial fruit Lambic! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, blueberries, oak barrel, and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to drink; thanks to the balanced tartness/acidity. Huge on the fruit presence, but still has nice classic lambic flavor/funk in the background. Nice sized malt support against acidity, but never overly sweet. A highly enjoyable offering.

0,33l can at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks for this one. BB 28/06/2017. black color, small redish / bourdeaux like / very dark head. smells of blueberries, bit milky, peppery, spices, some sourness, berry notes, bit woody, very nice smell. very nice smell. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather sour, light funk, grape, red wine notes, some marzipan, bit nutty, some wood, quite citric, acidic, lightly medical, some grass, bit milky. finishes quite dry and sour with notes of milk, citrus and light berry notes. quite nice beer. smells is very nice, taste is quite sour though, and not much fruits noticeable. overall taste reminds me more of a cheap wine than beer, but overall its still a quite enjoyable beer.

Can. Glass. Deep purple with small, light pink, semi-thick head. Moderately malty aroma with heavy yeasty profile - ready, dough. Secondly nice leathery, dusty and earthy notes. Of course tons of blueberries, but not really up-front. Taste is moderately sour, pretty tart and dry. Some acidic notes, high content of blueberries makes this slightly bitter in the end, which lasts for a quite a long time. Slightly ABV warming down the throat. In overall nice, a little bit too much blueberries, despite this lambic character is really present all around. Good brew.

Piwo którego trzeba spróbować, niesamowicie suche i wytrawne w smaku. Po wypiciu nie dałem rady RISa pić bo był tak słodki w porównaniu do tego spontana. Samo piwo pachnie owocowo i skórzane. Spodziewałem sie więcej smaku jagód ale jest klasa

Pours deep reddish blueberry into a snifter. Maroon head with good retention recedes to mottle surface. Blueberry and funk aromas. Dry with sweet blueberry upfront turning to tart skin and lactic aspirin before the medium length drying finish.
Tap @ Uiltje Bar. Dark purple color. Blueberries dominating the aroma. Milky flavor with lots of blueberries. Sour. tannines. I like it.
Draught at Uiltje bar. Pale purple with a pinkish head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice sourness with subtle sweet and bitter flavours. Blueberries, oak, tart and hay. Very good.
Sampled at Uiltje Bars Anniversary, 2017. Dark ruby pour with a violet head. Tons of blueberries, dark fruit, cherries, light raspberries. Quite tart but not acidic. A bit mouth-puckering.

Tap at Uiltje Bar. Super deep purple with dark purple head. Yoghurt, hay, massive blueberry, light lemon, soft funk, dank cellar notes. Medium sweet and sour with bitter fruit skins in the finish. Over medium bodied. Nice!

Tap at Uiltje Bar. Dark ruby with pink or purple tan head. Intense blueberry and raspberry, red wine, grape or cherry most. Big fruity, light metallic. Over medium body, dry feel, tannins. Nice stuff.

33cl can from mikkeller webshop. Dark rose black color. Head is rose/read thin and persistent. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet, medium highr sour. Medium body. Finish is dry. Medium carbonation. Aroma and flavour is blueberries, wood, herby, raspberries, barnyard.
Draft at Uiltje bar. Aroma of berries, tart and wheat. Taste has rich blue berries, tart, wheat, oak and a long rich fruity finish. This is great.
Draft at Uiltje bar. Purple with almost no head. Aroma of blueberries, tart, funk. Taste is moderate sour, dry mouthfeel, tart blueberry aftertaste. Nice

From draft at Uitlje Bar Haarlem during the Mikkeller tap-takeover. Pours a dark purple/ruby with a pinkish head. A shit ton of dark berries. Packed with fruit would be an understatement. Raspberry, blueberry, elderflower, oak, vanilla, funk. Dense, compressed fruits. Medium sour, medium sweet. Over medium body, low carbonation. Dry aftertaste, amazing.

On tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem during Mikkeller tap takeover. 
Nose is sour cherry, dark berries. 
Body is non-transparent deep ruby, head is small, red, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. 
Aroma is sour cherry, dark berries, sour apple, cherry, butter, chemical, brett. 
Light to medium sweet, medium fruity sour. 
Finish is medium lasting fruity medium sour, light umami. 
Full body, thick texture, nearly flat carbonation. 
Quite heavy fruit beer, well balanced, weird, not bad.

Łał. Fenomenalne piwo. Wygląda wspaniale, chyba pierwsze pełnoprawne 5 za wygląd. Zapach mógłby być nieco intensywniejszy, ale i tak super  borówki, nieco octu, dzikusy, jeszcze trochę borówek. W smaku jeszcze lepiej, tony borówek, mocna kwaśność, ale nie wykręcająca twarzy, przyjemnie ściągająca. Do tego nuta słodyczy (po ogrzaniu mocniejsza). Jest niesamowicie intensywne, dziko-borówkowy posmak pozostaje w ustach naprawdę długo. Dodatkowo całkiem wysokie wysycenie jeszcze podkręca owocowość. Ależ szkoda, że mam tylko jedną małą puszkę, mógłbym pić codziennie.

330 ml can from Mikkeller Webshop, bb 28/06/17.
Beautiful appearance, dark ruby body, with a big, frothy, lacing, dark pink-red head.
Aroma with loads of blueberries, barnyard, mild cheese, some red apples, some vinous notes.
Tastes of sour citrus, funk, smooth sour blueberries, apples, pears, some vinous notes.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes sour, smooth, a bit dry, with lots of lingering blueberries, some pears, some apples.

Tasty! All about the lovely blueberries, which are everywhere, while still quite diverse, with nice funk and other fruit notes. One of the best beers from the Spontan range, great stuff for blueberry lovers like me.

Can at Mikkeller and Friends
Beautiful deep dark red color with a lovely red foam head. Aroma is heavy of blueberries and vanilla. The taste is a little disappointing, no real lingering taste, it is quite sour but not much else going on. Kinda overrated to be honest, but beautiful appearance, but the taste needs a bit of work. But very interesting.

From notes. Had at a tasting with the group at Eriks house on January 22. 330 mL can. The pour is a dark, dark purple with a thick ring of dark pink head that vanishes slowly with a couple spots of lace left behind. Damn this looks good. The aroma is really sweet and fruity. There is a ton of blueberry skin and flesh, melding together well with the malts and a lot of lactic acid. There isnt an overdone acidity, but its really well balanced. I wish the fruit popped more. The flavor is much of the same. There is a little more sharpness to the fruits in the flavor, but Im not sure if its the fruits, the acid, the tartness, or all of the above. There is a pretty hefty funk on the back end to let you know youre not getting off too easily. The mouth feel is thicker and heavy with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly funky, yet tart blueberry. This is a really good offering compared to the last Spontan beer I had.
How: bottle Appearance: dark red with a medium pink head. Aroma: blueberry, wood, lemon juice, baking soda, stone fruits. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation.

Really dark, blood red color with dark pink head, looks amazing. Aroma has intense fermented berries but its not too acidic, it doesnt sting at all. Taste starts really fruity with medium tartness. Continues with some funky yeast notes, quite rustic. Finishes with rustic wood notes. Medium body, smooth but leaves your mouth really dry, well carbonated. 10℅ ABV is hidden extremely well. Overall its an excellent sour fruit ale, really intense, looks amazing and also has a great mouthfeel.

(330ml can from Mikkeller Webshop) Pours inky purple-black with a decent sized head of dark purkple-pink froth that fades to a cap with heavy lace. Aroma of rather massive blueberry, flesh and skin both, backed by other dark berry notes, maybe blackberry? Rather sour, lactic, some light dusty cellar note making its way past the berries. Flavour is heavy concentration of blueberry again, as expected, rather tart, a bit vinous with a hint of sweet fruit, a touch of the tannic fruit skin and oak notes, soft vanilla towards the back, and a little Brett on the finish and aftertaste to remind you its still lambic. Medium-full grippy body with rather spritzy carb and very little hint of the alcohol. Extremely blueberry-forward as the fruiting rate gives away, but doesnt quite reach the pure crushed blueberry of the quadruple. Tasty and fun if somewhat crazy.
Can at Tilt Brum; beetroot red fruit with a creamy dark pink head, aroma has intense fruit, taste has really smooth dark berries, quite tart, sweet fruits, hint of almond.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Spontantripleblueberry by Mikkeller at Apartamenty Saska nad JezioremAromat jagody za nimi troche dzikosci lambikowo skorzanej takiej, w smaku jagid mniej ciut i bardziej zlozone rzeczy wylaza, faaajneOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Duft rød kant sur blåbær lang dyb rød duft, smag rød frugt smag blåbær fyldig intens lidt rødvins ala kant
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice pink head with good duration. Color is purple. Aroma and taste are rich blueberries, fruits, malt, lactose acid, fruits and has a nice sweet sour finish.

Tap - aroma STRONG sour blueberries! Pours with a beautiful purple short lived head. Taste does not dissapoint, with a strong blueberry taste. Initially not as sour as the aroma suggests, bit eventually the sourness wins through at the end. Some carbonation tanginess, which would probsbly be lost (an improvement) if left to stand for a while... good stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour at Shelton Brothers. Deep purple with a small raspberry colored foam that dissipates. Looks like wine almost. Lots of blackberry and blueberry aromas. Vinous on the palate with good acidity. Berry skin and seed dryness. Fruit is loud and clear. Very nice.

Can:Deep blue color, or is it black? Purple head.Lactic aroma with notes of red currants and lots of blueberries. Thick mouth feel.Sourish taste with loads of blueberries.You dont drink this beer; you experience it!

Can @McHendos, Kishan is leaving, will he come back Tasting II. Pours purple, thick head which is a light purple/pink colour. Nose is blueberry, its tart and sour on the nose, big blueberry absolutely huge. Taste is the same, its a big sour tart fruit bomb, amazing.
Can at home. Pours deep purple, nose is blueberry, funk, toffee, taste is tart, blueberry, funky, toffee.

Niesamowite jest to piwo. Gęste, barwi jak farba, piana wręcz fioletowa. Widać że nie oszczędzali na jagodach i dali szuflę na litr lambika. Pachnie też znakomicie, funk, skóra, ziemia i pełno jagód/borówek. Smak mało kwaśny, średnio wytrawny, lekka ale stanowcza goryczka. W smaku cierpkie owoce leśne, na czele z jagodami i jeżynami, trochę czerwonej porzeczki i naprawdę dużo skóry oraz ziemi. Mimo 10% alkoholu nie czuć. Posmak wytrawny i lekko cierpki, w smaku agrest i skórki winogron. Klasa!

From can, poured a tick deep dark purple colour with a dark purple head. Nose of big tannis notes, lactic, big sour blueberries, bitter blueberry skin, oak notes, big tartness, kind of a weird full finish. Slow sipper
Mikkeller bar. Pours a deep purple blue with a pink head. Aromas of tart blueberry, wine tannins. Vinegar. Taste is tart sour with a red wine tannin finish. Impressive.

330ml can (thanks Mart). Violet dark purple blue color. Same color, bubbly head, stays. Blueberries, sweet and sour in aroma. Acidic, blueberries, fruity, tannins and leather in taste. Dry blueberry skins in aftertaste. Lots of tannins going on. Acidity covers alcohol well. Sharp mouthfeel. Weird brew.

Can (from mikkeller webshop). Pours dark red with red head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is so, berries, blackcurrant. Flavor is sour, funk, blueberries, blackcurrant, very intense, acidic.  Alcohol is well covered. Overall: ok, too acidic and intense.

Can shared by Mart, thanks! Dark purple beer, small pink head. Nose is blueberries, tart and lactic notes. Flavor is very tart, lots of sour berry notes, vanilla. Dry and lactic finish. Very tart and lactic. Tastes more of blackberries than blueberries.
Deep purple with a small pink head. Aroma is barnyard, blueberry and yeast. Taste is blueberry, vanilla and sour

Can. 
Deep purple pour, frothy head bright purple. 
Slightly sour nose, taste is sour with a fruity note. Smooth. 
Full body, soft carbonation.
Canned. Aroma of citrus, barnyard, lactic and Blueberry. The flavours starts light sweet but mainly sour, Tart berries. Complex. The body is medium and the texture is juicy. A good one...
Can. Pours deep purple with a thick purple head. Light acidic aroma with loads of blueberry. Bone dry and tart flavor with strong notes of blueberry and barnyard. No sign of the 10% abv. Lovely.

Can. Pours deep blue with a thick purple head. Aroma is like fermented blueberry, if there is such a thing. Very tart, strong. Good palate, medium body and carbonation. Sour finish, long. Very sour beer, with tones of blueberry. Not a beer to drink fast. This is a bit too much for me I think.
Draft at RB Best Fest 16: Poured a maroon with pink colored head. Aroma was super strong pungent blueberry. Taste was a sour/sweet mix of blueberry fruit. Very tart but had drink-ability too.

Canned. Pours deep purple with a small pinkish head. Aroma of blueberies, yeast and vanilla notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Can.
Pours dark red almost black, pink head.
Aroma of blueberries vanilla 
Taste lovely blueberry, nice texture, fresh clean, lambic feel. Like it.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends (Stefansgade), Copenhagen, into a Mikkeller tasting glass. It was a dark purple colour with a one finger purple head that quickly dissipates but has nice lacing. Aromas of blueberry, oak, barrel and tartness. Tastes tart and sour with tons of blueberries and other berries. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall this was wonderful. Great tart and fruitiness especially if you like blueberries.
Tap. Black, rocky head, medium sourness, lightly bitter, light sweetness, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.
Tap at Mikkeller Bar in Singapore. Rich deep purple pour - dense. Cool looking. Tart blueberry. Red wine, almost sangria like.

7.7%ABV. Lambic.

Tapped out a thick opaque purple.

Nose as rich acetic, yogurt aromas. There are a bunch of barnyard aromas as well with damp straw, dirt, "animal odors". Tang of manure. Lovely.

Mouthfeel is juicy. Palate has some aggressive tartness. There is the residual flavor and tannin-like mouthfeel of fresh berries. Overall the palate and the mouthfeel are redolent of cranberries.

A nice wild lambic. Solid.

Draft at Mikkeller CBC 2014.
Dark ruby, pink head.
Dry, medium body, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Fruity, compact blueberry notes, herbal, grassy notes, tart. Really nice! (2014-05 backlog)
Tap at mikkeller and friends, copenhagen. Dark red color, dark red head. Aroma has sour notes, blueberry, some vanilla notes. Sour blueberry taste, smooth, balanced and tart.

Tap@ Mikkeller and friends. Dark pink color head, otherwise black. Bit funky, berry notes, blueberries. Flavor has blueberries, funk, lactic notes. Loaded with blueberries. Fresh, nice mild tartness that these berries have. Excellent.

On tap at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is dark purple / violet with a small pink head. Aroma and flavor of blueberries, earth, tart acidity, and a bit of red wine. Finish has a bit too much vinegar/acidity for my liking.

On tap @ RateBeer Best 2016. This beer is kind of ridiculous. It was visibly staining peoples glasses, teeth, and tongues. So, yeah, theres some fruit character. Opaque purple looking beer with some light purple foam on top. I get a pretty good amount of blue cheese, barnyard, and basement funk. Of course, plenty of fruit and berry going on here. Like blueberry pie filling. Light to moderate sweetness, a fair amount of acidity, vinous, tannic berry. Wowe.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Tap at the Rate Beer Awards Festival. Huge blueberry nose, with good lambic notes of bretty funk, leather, citrus. Lovely purple color with lace. Great fruit flavor, yogurt and horse blanket. Excellent.

On tap at the RB festival 
Dark purple with a small purple head, purple stains in glass after rinsing several times. Aroma of blueberries and straw. Flavors of dark berries and yeasty 
Very nice
Draft. Purple beer with a purplish head. Big blueberry aroma. Blueberry and tart/light sour aroma. Medium bodied. Big blueberry lingers with a light sourness that helps cut this.

Sample at RateBeer Best 2015 festival. Pours deep deep burgundy blue, medium purple head that dissipates fairly slowly with good lacing. Beautiful beer actually. Aroma is is vinous, loads of blueberry and forest fruit, some lambic cheesiness, sweat socks and horse blanket. Flavor has a touch of berry sweetness, light tart, medium funky. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Soooo much better than the double. and very much not "just" a fruit beer.
On tap at ratebeer beerfest 2016. Pours purple with purple head. Taste is vinager and blue berrys with a big tartness. Stained my glass purple

On tap st Rate Beer Best. Pours Dark purple with a tiny purple head and a marvelous blueberry aroma. There is a powder dry sourish blueberry flavor - I see why it is triple blueberry. Its a pleasure to drink this very rare brew.

Sample on tap at ratebeer best. Deep purple black pour with purple head. Aroma is super fruity, blueberry juice. Taste is tart, very winey, red grape. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Good.
Very similar to the double. More blueberry so it says - maybe a touch fruitier and sweeter but I cant really tell as I did not have them back to back.
Wonderfully dense and sourness well-balanced with sweetness from the blueberries and wood. As many mentioned, the 10% hard to find.

Aroma is fruity, some tart wooden notes, berries as well as some dusty earthcellar notes. Flavour is sweetish sour with quite acidic notes to it. Long aftertaste. High ABV, but thats pretty much nowhere to be found in aroma or flavour.
Wonderful blueberries in aroma. The rest is blueberry like syrup. Very thick no funk no real tartness too candy like.
Tap @ CBC 2015, yellow session. Dark purple pour with a violet head. Nose has tart blueberries. Taste has blueberry soup, light tart super jammy and fruity!

tap at Mikkeller Bar. dark purple colour with burgundy reflections. light violet colour of head that disapperaed quickly, no lacing. intense aroma of sour blackberries and dry wine. the taste is dominated by sour berries. high carbonation. definitely worth trying.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Yellow session. Dark purple reddish color with purple head. Funky fruity aroma, berries, some barnyard notes. Light sweet and acidic taste like the aroma, tart berry fruity. Medium thin body with soft carbonation. It seems like 5% ABV.. I think 10% is a typo :P

On tap at Cafe Sara at the Mikkeller Tap Takeover
Dark purple, creamy pink head. Smell of blueberries, funk, cellar and light malts, complex and balanced. Moderate sweet, fruity blueberries, alot of tart fruity flavors, medium sour acids, funky with a nice complexity. Moderate bitter, cherry stone finish
-short review cbc- Dark blue with red head. One of the best appearances ive seen in a while. Blueberry, funk and fresh citrus. Summerbeer!

(Draught) the deepest purple you can imagine with deep pinkish/purple foam. Nose of Brett, Citrus, tons of blueberry, yogurt, tart and delicious, touch of earth. Taste of Brett, earth, yogurt bugs, tons of tart blueberry, complex and delicious. Excellent tart and earthy/flowery palate finish.

Keg at the Siren 2nd Anninversary bash, 07/03/15.
Blackish with blood red/purple hues, interesting colouration indeed!
Nose is rich red berry, blueberry must, funk, spice, plummy, tarte citric peel, woody tones.
Taste comprises horse blanket, less intense on the berry front, earthy, gentle red berry tartness, blueberry jus, musty wood, wild berries, citric peel, musty lemon rind.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a puckering linger.
Solid stuff, sounds like it shouldnt work but it works damn well, drinks way below 10%.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap at Siren Festival of Wood, 7th March 15. Wow this looks amazing, so colourful and rich, dark pink, red, with a thick, neat froth in top. Aroma is good for you fruit. The taste full on like a health smoothie, full of berries. Really great

Keg at Siren event. It pours deep purple with a thick deep pink head. The nose is earthy, funk, juicy blueberry, vinous, jammy, vimto, ribena and candy. The taste is crisp, tart, juicy, blueberry, Granny Smith apple, red grape, vinous, earth, funk, barnyard, so juicy, jam and good mouth-pucker with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. So juicy. A real looker as well. Tasty.
Draft at Mikkeller Bar in Reykjavik on opening night. Deep opaque purple color, pink edge head. Nice aroma of blueberry and citrus. Taste is full bodied and softly sour berries. Tasty.

Tap at Mikkeller and Friends Reykjavik. Pours opaque purple with a small, frothy purple head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is phenolic blueberry, light pale malt and earthy notes. Flavor is tart and lactic blueberry, phenols, light malt and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Draught. Creamy red mostly lasting head. Deep red colour. Light malty and hoppy heavy blueberry aroma. Heavy bitter nice balaced flavor between sour/berries. Long intense great finish. Creamy palate. World class.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 150123. Fruity and sour with blueberries, sweet, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is tart and acidic with blueberries.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar 23/1-15. Blueberries, fruity, acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry and acidic.

Intense purple red colour, purple head. Aroma of blueberry, horse blanket, forest floor, pediococcus. Sour flavour, fruity, blueberry, yoghurt. Finish blueberry, tart citrus, lactic acid. Nice.(from draught @ CBC blue session, Copenhagen 2014. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)
Smakprov på CBC i Köpenhamn 2014. Smak och doft av syrliga bär, mycket blåbär, lagom sötma med bra syrlighet.

Il trionfo della frutta: una cornucopia ridondante di mirtilli che invade il palato come 1500 gr di militi agguerriti che planano sui loro rampanti destrieri di acidità, morbida e intensa, per un sorso afrodisiaco per tutti i sensi uniti in una radiosa lode alla birra!!

WOW. This is on my to 3 list. Hardcore lots of blueberries in this one. ( They say 800g per liter, correct me if im wrong) but what a sourness, a blueberrytaste and a nice balance. Deep sapphire blue. From tap at Mikkeller tasting. This is the beer i could drink for the rest of my life, too bad its so costy :)

3rd May 2014CBC Session 3. Opaque dark purple beer, vibrant purple head. Palate is dry and crispy. Starts with a brief sourish note and then rich blueberry and a just a touch of acid. Not much else going on. Light dry finish.

Fra fat på denne enestående Brewers Night på Cardinal: blåbærfarge også i skummet, minner om barndommens hjemmelagede blåbærsaft i utseende. Heftig smak av blåbær - dette er helsekost i hver dråpe (antioksidanter!). Lambicaroma og -smak i tillegg. Tørr så det holder, ingen hjemmelaget blåbærsaft allikevel. Unik og lekker. For en superb aften!

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, red session. 03/05/2014. Deep red purple coloured pour, lovely lasting deept pink head. Really thick, looks like a fruit smoothy. Aroma is tart fruit, cherry, some vinegar and socks. Flavour is really tart cherry, blueberry skins, some socks, funk. Palate is think on the tongue, drying tanin. Interesting, but lacks refinement.

On tap at Mikropolis, july 26th 2014. Blueberries. Thats what it is. Bartender was careful to tell us not to spill on our clothes, as we wouldnt get rid of the blueberry stains. Purple body, with a lighter purple fading to pink head. I think Beautiful is the word Im looking for. Aroma is only lightly sour, with no surprise a heavy blueberry dominance, also some citrus fruits and blackberries. Taste is quite funky with a rising sourness, again plenty of blueberries, sweetened a bit by vanilla and caramel, citrussy and blueberry finish. Just great!
Draught at CBC 2014. Dark reddish colour with a pink head. Aroma and flavour of blueberries, acidic and tartness.
On tap Cardinals Brewers Night. Pours dark reddish with a small pinkish head. Aroma of lambic, sour blueberries. Taste is thick fresh berries moderate sour, thick oily mouthfeel, lovely beer.

On tap @ Cardinal, Stavanger, Brewers night. Pours deep dark blue with a small blue head. Aroma is nice tart with shitloads of blueberries, as well as wooden barrels, some leather and a nice funkiness. Medium body with no carbonation. Flavour is tart with vinegar, brett, farmyard and blueberries, as well as wood, dark fruits and berries. Lingering funky blueberry finish. A truly unique and tremendous brew.
DWF på fat Cardinals Brewers Night,Rødlig farge med masse rødt skum. Så litt farlig ut... Aroma av gjær, lambic, blåbær. Smak av lambic, blåbar, Veldig syrlig. Men dog god

On tap at Cardinals big Brewers Night, Deep, deep red to purple colour, large red to purple head. Aroma of lambic / farmhouse and blueberries. Very sour flavour (too sour?), blueberries and lemons, tart finish.

Dark violet, almost black. Persistent violet head and lacing. Sour lambic aroma. Good lambic taste as well. With just a bit of fantasy and goodwill I can also taste blueberries, particularly in first aftertaste. Appropriately dry mouthfeel.

On tap at Cardinal during Brewers Night, purple body with a dense purple head. Lovely berry and lambic notes on the nose. Tart, grape juice and blueberries in the mouth, all thick and pungent. Full bodied. Good match.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours deep deep blue with a creamy pinkish blue head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is very fruity and very tiny funky with bilberries, lemon juice, hay, lemon zest, barnyard, leather and hints of horse blanket. Taste is very sour and fruity with crackers, lemon juice, tons of bilberries, hay, dry soil, horse blanket, vinegar and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, slightly mouth-puckering and medium to full bodied. Finish is sour and fruity with crackers, lemon juice, bilberries, hay, dry soil, lemon zest and hints of horse blanket. Is there such a thing as too many bilberries?

Draught @ CBC 2014 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Mikkeller Spontantripleblueberry ].Clear dark dark purple color with a average, frothy - creamy, excellent lacing, fully lasting, purple head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to heavy yeasty, bread, dough, blueberry, baking yeast, pastry cream - custard creams. Flavour is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart berries, blueberry, dough. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20140502]
Blueberry aroma was fantastic. A bit too much in the flavor and somewhat cloying. May be with time will get better. Great tartness, only complaint is thickness from fruit. Could get better

Draught at CBC 2014. Deep purple liquid with a medium purple head. Aroma of blueberries, earth, funk and lemon. Taste is dry and high sour with notes of blueberries, earth and funk. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very earthy. Insane color.
Dark purple with a pink head. A lot of blueberries both in the aroma and taste. Very tart and with a lot of funk.
On tap at CBC 2014. Dark purple with purple head. Aroma is tart, berries, funky, massive blueberries. Taste is sour, tart, rich & full, lots of blueberries, long berry finish

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 March 14, 2015. On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. 
Get more distinct blueberry notes this time, nice tart and funky. 


Original rating: 
Sample at CBC. Pours vary dark purple, almost black with a nice purple head. Aroma is tart blueberries with funky notes. Taste is dry tart blueberries, tannic. Medium smooth body, soft carbonation. 
7-5-7-4-15=38
Cbc 14. Pours an opaque black with a light purple head. Medium tartness. Light sourness. Loads of blueberry aromas. Full bodied! Medium to soft carbonation. Bitter berry finish.

Tap @ CBC. Pours like cand... eh, I mean beer! A very nice looking beer. Quite an astonishing beer, actually. Pours a deep dark purple with no head at all. Aromas of tart, yoghurt, ripe blueberries, red fruits jam. No carbon. Sour starting taste, slightly sugary, woody and yeast. Very sour aftertaste, fruity and ending in a very dry mouthfeel.

24/V/14 - draft sample @ Procrastinated Spontan Gent Tasting - BB: n/a (2014-541) Thanks to Tinus for sharing the beer!
Little cloudy dark purple beer, no head. Aroma: first some yoghurt notes, then weet and ripe blueberries, sour touch, red fruits jam. MF: no carbon, full body. Taste: sourish start, bit sugary, bitter tannins (from the peels?), woody, bit smoky/charcoal. Aftertaste: very sour, puckering, bitter tannins, fruity, skin/peel from the berries, dry ending.

Draught @ CBC14, Copenhagen.
App: Muddy dark purple/blue, fluffy gorgeous pink and white head.
Aroma: Tart and funky blueberry aroma with some vinegar notes.
Taste: Pretty sour and pithy/grainy blueberry flavour with lemon, vinegar, wood and brett.
Palate: Medium body, soft to crisp carbonation, oily texture.
Overall: Its like the Spontandoubleblueberry but with just more of everything, and I think it goes a bit over the top.
CBC. Unclear dark purple with a purple head. Aroma is sweet, malty, blueberry and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 020514

Aroma and taste is berry fruity (prominent blueberry), tart and acidic, very different, impressed with this.

Thnx to ships 
Pours very dark red, darkpink foam . 
Smell is pure fruity 
Low carbo. Thick , sweet, dry-to-the-extreme beer , with a fleshy back . Pretty nice , but probably a bit too extreme. Surprising , after the very unintense and borning doubleblueberry

Thanks to Martinus for this one. Dark rhubarb purplish blue with no head. Nose is very thick blueberry juice mixed with a touch of lactic yoghurt, sweet juice and something light fermenting. Thick sweetish blueberry smoothie juice taste, faint lactic leading into a very dry lingering vinous finish, totally dry-out blueberry skins. Flat thick blueberry smoothie interesting. Interesting, 1 % ABV & 1.5 kg. of blueberries per 1 litre of lambiek so this is basically funky blueberry juice? Intriguing.

Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours a deep dark reddish purple aroma with a small pinkish purple head. Has a fruity tart strong blueberry aroma. Fruity tart blueberry flavor. Has a fruity tart spicy strong blueberry finish.
Pours deep dark lilac blue with a great creamy blue lilah head leaving lace. Aroma is sour blueberries cellar dry funky. Flavor is very good, blueberries sour fresh.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Dark purple body, light purple pink head,; this one looks more like a blueberry juice than anything else. Aroma is bretty sour hay tones, loads of blueberry, strawberry and hints of lemon juice. Taste is tart bretty tones with loads of lemons, blueberries, black currants and hints of dry hay. Light body, medium carbonation. Quite a lovely little low alcohol sour creation from Mikkeller; and extra props for managing fermentation vs. alcohol vs. flavor so well..1 %? For real? :-D

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours opaque purple with an amazing purple head, aroma of blueberries and brett, flavor is sour with blueberries and brett, medium to full bodied, Crazy.
From tap. Pours dense purple and with a red head. Aroma is dense fruity and tart flavoured. Citric and dry finish.

Tap @ CBC14-red. Magenta.. dark violet coloured with a slight head. Funky blueberries, acidic body and dry. Intensively flavoured with dark (blue-) berries, some hayish malts, bit of barnyard. Like the colour, and nice beer, but guess I was expecting more.

[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 1st session. Amazing deep purple-red color with a purple head. Amazing funky aroma full of blueberries. Great sour flavor, funky, with barnyard and a lot of blueberries. Rounded mouthfeel. Amazing.
Draught at CBC 2014. Deep dark (almost black) - dark red/purple head. High high high berries, zesty, earthy, nice acid, sourness, tartness, zesty bitterness, barnyard notes. Lovely.

02-MAY-2014, draft @CBC, blue session.
Red, dense, almost black. Aroma is funk, almost fart. Taste is huge fart & blueberry. So dense, so sweet, so very tart. Full body, medium carbonation. Actually overdone. 1 kg pr. liter is enough:0)

Draft at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Session 3. Pours deep purple with a thick, pink foam head; it looks fabulous. It is a nice beer overall, though not without its faults. Good berry tartness. But just far too dry, tannic. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Moderately clean to finish but it really dried your whole mouth out. Some lingering blueberries, berry skins. In the end, its not super drinkable.

Kan innehålla spår av vatten. Annars är det nog i princip bara ett sjuhelsikes lass med blåbär i den här.
Sur, sträv och väldigt blåbärsdominerad. 
På CBC-14
Tap @ CBC, 14. Deep baclk/purple with purple head. Aroma is malt, blueberries, tart , fruit and berries. Flavour is malt, blueberries, tart, sour, little acid and wood.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours deep purple with a pink / red head. Aroma of light sourness, bakers yeast, blueberry, cakecream. Flavor is light sour, tart, rich blueberry, sweetness, vanillla. Full body, soft carboantion, sweet, yet light acedic finish. 030514

Session 2, Copenhagen Beer Festival, draught. Dark red coloured body. Naked surface. Tart and sweet aromas. Flavour of very tart blue berries, almost sour, joined by almond. Drinkable, but really not my kind of beer (02.05.2014).
At CBC. Black colour with red head. Fruity, blueberry and brett aroma. Blueberry, brett, acidic taste, with sweet finish. Medium body.

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours dark purple with a lasting and good lacing intense purple head. Aroma is brett, blueberry and sour fruit. Taste is moderate sweet and near heavy tart. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes very dry, mineral, tart and fruity. More please.

Tap @cbc14. Pours thick deep blue with small pink lasting head. Aroma is first sour brett then blueberry and some vinegar like. Taste is BERRIES and a bit spicy. Medium body with long lasting taste of blueberry and some acid. Palate is quite dry. Would have guessed on much more alcohol than it is. Just like eating blueberries. A really beautiful beer!

On tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass deep pink, nice head. Fine fruity aroma, modest sourish. Starts intense fruity without being too much. Fruity notes not as intense as exspected. Fine fruity berry aroma with every sip. Mild sourish aftertaste. Really nice!
Looks like the spontanbeetroot. huge medicine blue. 1 finger head nose is very blabaer. roots and acidic. taste is merlot grape, tannic, jammy, sweet acidity.

Sampled @ CBC 2014. Opaque, very dark purple color, sort of deep "dark pink" head. Aroma is quite subtle, fruity and nice, but the taste is incredibly sour. The sourness totally dominates all fruity flavors that could be in there. Too bad imo.

Smagsprøve fra fad på CBC 2014. Usandsynlig smuk farve, dyb lilla med en tynd men skælvende lyse-lilla skumhat. Duft intent sur-sødt af blåbær. Sød, frugtig og sur i munden, med en syrlig-tør finish. God.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Copenhagen, session 2. Dark red/ruby beer with a deep red/pinkish head. Blueberry aroma, citrus, grapes, some wild strawberries. Blueberry flavor, caramel grapes, wild strawberries, citrus notes. Very, very nice.

Draught at CBC.
Pours heavy purple.
Much fruity tartness, lots of blueberry and some earthy notes. Not much beer...

Draught CBC 2014. Deep dark red coloured. Huge reddish head. Aroma. Intense blueberry, tart, sweetness, some spice, sourness and a brettish/funky touch. Flavour. Again loads of blueberry, sweetness, tart, sourness, citrus, grape and funk. Medium to full bodied. Ends very tart and dry full of blueberries. Quite intense and delicious

CBC 2014. Pours dark Purple with a dark red head. Aroma is intense concentrated blueberry juice, vanilla and funk. Taste is very intense blueberry, funk, slight vanilla. Mouth is tart and quite dry with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is pure concentrated blueberries.

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Dark purple with a pink head. A lot of blueberries both in the aroma and taste. Very tart and with a lot of funk. Almost too much but I stil liked it. Would love to try this one again.
Smakprov på CBC 2014. Vackert blålila med rosa skum. Stor funkig syrlig doft. Kärv, syrlig, sträv, stram, mycket blåbär och funk. Otroligt bra.

Tap @ CBC . Pours like no other beer in the world! At least I have never seen anything like this. Deep blue color with a red/blue head. What a stunning looking beer! Aroma of fresh harvested blueberries (well what have you expected???) Tarty notes, wild brett notes and just spot on and intense blueberry aroma. Taste is ... Blueberries with sour and wild notes added. I was amazed!

Draught at CBC 2014.
Black coloured with a medium sized purple head.
Light acidic aroma of berries and barnyard.
Acidic flavour of blueberries and barnyard.
Tart finish.
Draft at CBC 2014. Pours deep purple with a purple head. Massive blueberry and funky aroma. Flavor is light sweet and over moderate acidic. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Amazing for the ABV.

Tap @ CBC 2014. Pours deep purple to black with a small, staying, creamy purple head. Aroma has clear blueberries, light butterscotch,. Low carbonation, fine dry and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour has good tartness, almost chalky, blueberries, tart. A bit over the top.

Sample @ CBC 14. Pours the darkest purple beer Ive ever seen with a deep dark purple thin head on top. Aroma has massive barnyard funk mixed with some amazing fruity essences. Flavor is quite sour and tart, dry mouthfeel and loads of the blueberries return in the back of the flavor. Well balanced, amazing beer.

Pours deep purple with cherry pink head. Aroma of intense cherry and blueberries, blackberries etc - the berry basket. Taste is very fruit tart, a touch unbalanced, little to no sweetness. Body is light and crisp with soft carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample @ CBC. Intense, almost too intense. Very sour. Unpleasant bitterness. I liked doubleblueberry better.

CBC 2014
Pours dark purple with low purple head
Aromas of
Taste is well balanced of nice sourness and subtle blueberrie note

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014.  Dark purple with a large dark pink head. Aroma is blueberries, sourness, barnyard funk. Full bodied, cream mouthfeel, quite tart on the palate with a hint of sweetness, long fruity dry finish. Taste is blueberries, blackcurrants, cider vinegar.
Tap @ CBC, cph. Deep red/purple, small reddish head, nice lacing. Really sour and tart. Red berries. Too sour for my taste
Tap at the Copenhagen beer festival... Deep red black... Sift deep red head... Looks like beetroot juice but thicker... Tart sour fruits front... Juicy fruits.. Long and tart
Tap cbc black deep red head. Lambic sour aroma little bit of glue. Flavor is super sour, citrusst. Citrus st berries,

CBC 14. Pours Black. Head is Dark pink to purple. Aroma is very sour. Blueberry, vinegar.. And that's about it. Taste is sour as well. Pretty dry, but still very fruity. Blueberry of course dominates everything. Good beer, but might be a waste of berries. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ CBC14
Very unusual appearance  like a berry porridge. Aroma is tart with berries  especially blackcurrants. Flavour is tart with blackcurrants, some earthy and leathery notes. Unusual and hides the 1% ABV well. Not sure what to think about this, but at least I am not getting another glass.

Draught @ CBC 2014

Pours dark pink with a pink head(!). Aroma of blueberry juice, tartish notes, some mild sourness. Taste is pure tart blueberry juice with mild sourness and lambicy notes. Finish is sweet, juicy and tartish with loads of - you guessed it - blueberries. Quite an extreme sour ale.

Draught @ CBC2014, Copenhagen. Pours a very deep, dark, ruby red colour with a pink foam. Aroma of blueberry pie, wet earth and mild vinegar notes. Flavour is very sharp with tart blueberries, mild vinegar tartness, wood and . Bone-dry mouthfeel with an extremely dry, berryish finish. Very unique.

Tap @ CBC14.
Pours dark violet color with a small pink head. Bilberries on the aroma, some rowan berries also. Very sour palate with bilberries and citric fruits. Nice and intense.
4365
